intro: Pleurostachys ulei, commonly known as the silverleaf yucca, is a member of the Asparagaceae family. It is a perennial shrub native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant features gray-green, narrow, sword-shaped leaves that are arranged in a rosette. It produces yellowish-white flowers in clusters during the summer months. The plant is adapted to arid environments and is drought-tolerant, making it well-suited for xeriscaping.
